title: 3 Easy Ways to Use Google Chrome on a TV

steps.title: Connect your Chromecast to your television.
steps.content: Connect your Chromecast to your television. To use Google Chrome on your television, you’ll need have a Chromecast already hooked up to your television . You can also use a TV with Google Cast built in. This method will work for the Windows, Mac, and ChromeOS versions of the browser. Make sure your Chromecast and TV are on.

steps.title: Connect to the same Wi-Fi network as the Chromecast.
steps.content: Connect to the same Wi-Fi network as the Chromecast. If your computer is not already connected to Wi-Fi, connect it now.

steps.title: Open Chrome on your computer.
steps.content: Open Chrome on your computer. Chrome has a built-in "Cast" feature that allows you to send a Chrome tab to your TV. Make sure Chrome is updated to the latest version.

steps.title: Visit any website in Chrome.
steps.content: Visit any website in Chrome. Load up a website, such as wikiHow.com , so you’ll have something to cast to the TV. You can also use a streaming website, such as Netflix or Hulu .

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This is in the top-right corner. The Settings menu will expand.

steps.title: Hover over "Save and share".
steps.content: Hover over "Save and share". This is near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Cast….
steps.content: Click Cast… . Chrome will search for a Chromecast or Cast-enabled television. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the arrow next to "Sources".
steps.content: Click the arrow next to "Sources". You’ll see two options: Cast tab and Cast screen .

steps.title: Select Cast tab.
steps.content: Select Cast tab . If you want to share your entire computer screen, select Cast screen instead.

steps.title: Select your Chromecast from the list.
steps.content: Select your Chromecast from the list. In a few seconds, the site you loaded in the browser will appear on your television screen. You can browse to other websites while casting to the TV—just be sure you’re staying in the correct browser tab. When you’re ready to stop using Chrome on your TV, either close the browser tab or click Stop .

steps.title: Connect your Chromecast to your television.
steps.content: Connect your Chromecast to your television. If you have an Android device, you can cast your entire desktop to a TV using a Chromecast. When your desktop is cast to the TV, you’ll be able to run Chrome and any other app on your device.

steps.title: Launch the Google Home app.
steps.content: Launch the Google Home app. This app allows you to connect different Google and Android devices in your household. You can find it in the Google Play Store. If you don't have Google Home, download it from the Play Store. You'll need to set up Google Home first.

steps.title: Connect to the same Wi-Fi network as the Chromecast.
steps.content: Connect to the same Wi-Fi network as the Chromecast. If your Android is not already connected to Wi-Fi, connect it now.

steps.title: Tap Devices.
steps.content: Tap Devices . You can also tap Favorites .

steps.title: Tap and hold the Chromecast.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Chromecast. This will be in the list of devices.

steps.title: Tap Cast.
steps.content: Tap Cast . You can find this in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Cast screen.
steps.content: Tap Cast screen . This is at the bottom.

steps.title: Launch the Chrome app on your Android device.
steps.content: Launch the Chrome app on your Android device. Like any other app, the contents of Chrome will now appear on the TV screen. As you browse the web, each page you click to will appear on the TV screen until you disconnect from the Chromecast. To stop casting, open the Google Home app again. Tap Devices or Favorites , tap and hold the Chromecast tile, and then tap Stop mirroring .

steps.title: Turn on your TV.
steps.content: Turn on your TV. To use AirPlay to mirror your iPhone or iPad, you must have an Apple TV or AirPlay-compatible smart TV. If you're unsure, check your device's manual. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Connect both devices to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect both devices to the same Wi-Fi network. This is how your TV and iPhone/iPad will link together.

steps.title: Open the Control Center.
steps.content: Open the Control Center . Swipe down on the top-right corner of the screen. If you have a Home button, swipe up from the bottom.

steps.title: Tap Screen Mirroring.
steps.content: Tap Screen Mirroring . This is the two overlapping rectangles. The full menu should open with a list of devices.

steps.title: Tap your TV name.
steps.content: Tap your TV name. If you don't see your TV, make sure it's on and connected to the same Wi-Fi network. You may be asked to enter an AirPlay passcode. Enter the code shown on your TV onto your iPhone or iPad. Your device should begin mirroring.

steps.title: Open the Google Chrome app.
steps.content: Open the Google Chrome app. Like any other app, the contents of Chrome will now appear on the TV screen. To stop screen mirroring, open the Control Center again. Tap Stop Screen Mirroring .
